TF050281-STRUCTURAL ADJUSTMENT CREDIT
            FOR MOLDOVA,TF037721-ECA REGION - TELECOMMUNICATIONS,TF036687-GLOBAL - TELECOMMUNICATIONS,TF035144-UZBEKISTAN - ENTERPRISE REFORM PROJECT,TF034007-UZBEKISTAN - FINANCE,TF033527-UZBEKISTAN - ENTERPRISE REFORM PROJECT,TF033430-UZBEKISTAN - ENTERPRISE REFORM
            LOAN PROJECT,TF024834-DUTCH GRANT IN SUPPORT OF THE
            MOLDOVA STRUCTURAL ADJUSTMENT CREDIT,TF029330-PHRD -ENTERPRISE REFORM PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Structural Adjustment Credit (SAC)
            Project's outcome is rated as satisfactory,
            sustainability as likely, institutional development impact
            as modest, Bank performance as satisfactory, as Borrower
            performance as satisfactory. Key lessons learned from the
            implementation include: It is important to adequately take
            into account the political economy of the evolving
            situation. Delays in implementing certain of the agreed
            measures did lead to some reduction in effectiveness of the
            program supported under the SAC. Improved public expenditure
            management requires fundamental change in the
            Government's range of commitments. Post-privatization
            market development and support are needed to help contribute
            more quickly to an upswing in agricultural production and
            the development of rural wealth. For energy, as in the past
            the priority must be to bring in more competent private
            operators who have the technical know-how and financial
            resources to restore sector efficiency. Delays in
            privatization of attractive state enterprises, even in the
            fact of strong political opposition, should be avoided if at
            all possible.
